So where are you at on this thing?
Well. Our guy's killed one victim every month. (MORE) (CONTINUED )

DETECTIVE GRIMES (cont'd) Each one going missing, then turning up dead one to two weeks later. All of them found nude and face down in the trunk of their own cars. Literally hours after their death. All asphyxiated. None of the bodies sustaining any kind of visible, physical damage. That means he’s holding them for long periods of time without actually touching them. When he DOES finally finish the job, he keeps it clean. Painless. He also makes sure we find them fast by parking their cars in public places and leaving the trunks open.
So if he’s not interested in sex, why is he leaving them nude?
We have a couple theories. One is he can’t get it up. And maybe he gets himself off by watching. The other is he gets off by humiliating the victim. That he’s undressing them post-mortem.
And what do you think?
I think our guy’s trying to tell us something.
Like...?

Like how strong he is. That these prom queen types aren’t worth his time. Think about it. You‘re this lonely kid. You can’t get laid. You've been turned down by every chick in school. So you go pick out the hottest girl in class, stick a knife to her throat and drag her out into the woods for some alone time. Then you make her take her clothes off. (CONTINUED )
Only you don’t touch her cos you’re better than she is. And you want her to know it.

Exactly. You just watch her beg. You wanna embarrass her and humiliate her, just like she did to you. But he doesn’t do it quickly. He prolongs it. It’s like the longer he goes without touching these girls, the stronger he gets.
And what better place than the woods? She could scream her lungs out for hours and nobody would hear.
And he can’t let her go after what he’s done. So he finds the most humane way of completing the act. He holds them down until they simply run out of air.
When that becomes boring to him...

+.+eHe’ll start hurting them for real. I figure it’s only a matter of time before this kid gets knife happy. A woman in her forties cautiously approaches the men. shut in, quiet house mother type. Her clothes are old and worn. They almost look to have been sewn together with he own hands. This is JANIS ROOKER. Her face is old, tired before her time.
(to Grimes) Excuse me, Detective? The two men turn.
Are you Detective Joe Grimes? (CONTINUED )
Yes, mam. What can I do for you?

My name‘s Janis Rooker. I live just down the street. I saw the commotion from the supermarket. I couldn’t help but recognize the shopping cart on the sidewalk. Janis stares down the sidewalk at the body under the shee
I knew this man. Sort of. His name was John, right?
Yes, mam. I’m very sorry.

My son told me about him once. He would give him money from time to time. After awhile they became sort of...strange friends you could say. Janis tears up, as if she’s going to lose it any second. Detective Reinhardt and Grimes share a confused look.
Mam, is there something you wanna tell us?
This might sound a bit crazy, but...I think I might know who you're looking for.

THE SCARY MAN, now dressed in the wool, navy blue suit, d shirt and tie, stands under a corner stop sign, staring d the street at THE REINHARDT HOME. We still c a time. annot see his face, just parts of him, one piece at -- The back of his head. (CONTINUED )

-- His black gloved hands, with the finger tips cut off. long, dirty, unkempt fingernails stick out. -- A pair of dark, menacing eyes, open wide, gazing at th house in an almost trance-like state. The Mustang is parked against the curb across the street, of sight. A woman walking her dog comes up the sidewalk. As she com closer, she gets a better look at the scary figure and is instantly frightened. She quickly scoops up her dog, curl in her arms like a newborn baby, and begins across the street.
Cassie finishes tying her shoe laces, grabs a twenty doll bill from her dresser and shoves it down her pocket. She leaves.
Cassie hurries down the steps. As she steps into the livi room, she hears the sound of a toilet flushing.
Jake walks out of a nearby bathroom, the toilet still flushing. He runs into Cassie.
I don’t even wanna know what you were doing in there.
Using the toilet.
Yeah, I bet. As soon as my back is turned. God. You little whackers are like machines.
You're disgusting. Besides. You don't keep any good magazines under the sink. (CONTINUED )
Sorry we can’t be more accommodating. Cassie grabs Jake and walks him toward the door.
Let's go.
Hey. How come we‘re not doing delivery?
Because we‘re gonna use the change to rent some movies, dumb bell. Cassie and Jake walk out the front door, going to get the pizza.
Can we rent a porno?

From the stop sign at the end of the street, we watch CAS AND JAKE walk out the front door and begin down the stree Only this time, the scary man is nowhere to be seen. We DOLLY RIGHT, moving further down the connecting street We keep dollying right until Cassie and Jake are no longe sight. We move slowly along the curb until we reach the 1967 Mustang, parked out of sight. The windows are dark, tinte We cannot see inside.

SCARY MAN‘S P.O.V. He watches as Cassie and Jake reach the stop sign at the corner and begin down the opposite end of the street. He starts the engine and begins down the street toward th The two are oblivious, ignoring the oncoming car. (CONTINUED )

Instead of following them, he makes a right turn and begi toward The Reinhardt home. He slowly approaches the front the house and parks. Out steps the scary man. SCARY MAN'S P.O.V. The killer walks across the driveway and around the side the house, toward the back yard. He approaches a small chain link gate, opens and walks in the back yard. There is a somewhat unkempt swimming pool area. A lawn ch is opened up where Cassie was presumably laying out the d before. He continues to the back of the house and spots t back door. He opens and walks inside.

The scary man moves further into the home, into the TV ro He stares down at the coffee table and notices only a jar half-eaten roasted peanuts. He moves away from the living room and continues checking immediate area. He stares into the kitchen and notices TH TELEPHONE sitting on a charger. He walks toward it, snatc it up.
Detective Reinhardt and Grimes have a seat at the dinner table as Janis brings them coffee.
I’ve been following your case very closely around the time the third girl went missing.
Courtney Harris?
Yes. I was surprised when the news kept calling him a sexual deviant, since none of the girls were reported to have been harmed sexually. (MORE) (CONTINUED )
JANIS (cont'd) (to both cops) They weren’t, were they? Detective Grimes and Reinhardt share a look.

Besides removing their clothes, they were never sexually assaulted. Just asphyxiated. Janis fades off into a deep trance, thinking it all over. Detective Grimes takes notice of her strange behavior. Janis breaks her silence.

When my Alex was fifteen, he was expelled from school. He followed this girl into the shower room after class let out. He kept her there for nearly three hours before someone found them. Detective Reinhardt and Grimes share another look.
First, he barricaded the room so she couldn’t get out. Then he stuck a knife to her throat and dared her to scream out. But never touched her. Not once. Just watched her beg for her life.
What happened to the girl?

The janitor found them before he was able to...do anything. Because the girl wasn’t hurt physically and Alex had no prior record, the court ordered him to a psychiatric hold for thirty days. Detective Reinhardt listens carefully. He’s getting his o mind set back.
A lot of good that did. When he was released, the doctors couldn’t find anything wrong with him. They said he was a completely sane, healthy fifteen year old boy. (CONTINUED )
Detective Grimes rolls his eyes a bit, shakes his head in disbelief.
They couldn't explain what happened. Neither could Alex. He told me he couldn’t remember any of it.
Did you believe him?
Yes I did. It seemed like he was growing more and more angry every day. This went on for weeks. Until one day, something inside him snapped. He just took off with no warning.
How long has he been gone?
It was almost six months ago. He packed some clothes and his camp gear and left. I haven’t heard from him since.
Camp gear?

Alex had a tent. He used to like to go camping with his father before he died. To tell you the truth, it was the last time I remember him ever being happy. When he left, he took it with him. Detective Reinhardt stares off into the distance, looking over Janis
Detective Reinhardt spots a Mustang sitting on the soft shoulder near the woods. headed for the house.
Detective Reinhardt snaps out of it. Him and Jake continue past the car, (CONTINUED )
Son of a bitch. Detective Grimes stares up at his ex partner, confused.
What is it?
(to Janis) This tent. What color was it? EXT. RESIDENTIAL SIDEWALK -— DUSK Cassie and Jake strut up the sidewalk, headed back to the house, carrying a large pizza and a bag of some rented DV movies.
Why couldn’t we get any scary movies?
Because scary movies are stupid and senseless.
What're you talking about? Horror movies have it all. You got your humor, romance, suspense, tits and ass.
I knew it. You just wanna see a bunch of naked girls.
You say that like it’s a bad thing.
You have a lot of your brother in you. You know that?
I think every movie should have naked girls.
Oh, yeah? (CONTINUED )
That way it wouldn’t be so hard to pick out a movie at the video store. You just walk in and grab one. That way if you get stuck watching a chick flick, at least there’s naked babes. Cassie laughs.

You are Matt’s brother, aren‘t you? Jake looks up and spots the 1967 Mustang sitting at a cur He stops in his tracks. Jake doesn’t flinch. He simply stands in shock, staring a the pink car. Cassie stops, stares back at him, waiting.
What?
(whispers) Come here.
What’s your problem?
That’s the car I saw. At the park. Cassie turns and stares down the street.
Don’t look!
You mean that car on the curb?
That’s him. It’s the man from the woods. I know it is. Cassie stares down at the license tag. The word “HOTTIE” the front. She laughs a bit.
Hottie? How tough can this guy be? (CONTINUED )
It was near the woods. Close to where your Dad picked me up. Cassie turns and looks at the car again.
I said don’t look! Cassie recognizes the license tag on the front of the car
Wait a minute. That’s Linda Morehouses‘s car.
Who?
Linda Morehouse. She's head cheerleader. Her plate says “hottie” just like that one.
She live around here?
No. She lives across town. (squints, confused) Nowhere near here, actually.
Does she have short blonde hair? Kind of curly?
Yeah.
You seen her at school lately? Cassie stops. Ponders a bit.
No. Actually, I heard she missed the pep rally today. Cassie stares up at the Mustang, now a bit scared.
Let's just keep walking. But stay behind me, out of sight. Okay? (CONTINUED )
Jake nods. The two begin up the sidewalk, a bit faster th time. Cassie checks the Mustang car and notices the HEADLIGHTS on.
Shit! Walk faster! Cassie and Jake are now hurrying, almost trotting up the sidewalk. The car pulls away from the curb, inching along the side the street, keeping a steady pace with Cassie and Jake.
He’s following us.
I said stay out of sight. Cassie spots the stop sign ahead. Their street.
We‘re almost there. When we get to the stop sign, I want you to run like hell to the house. You got it?
I got it. Cassie and Jake are almost to the stop sign as the pink c slows to a halt, waiting for them. They finally reach the corner.

Cassie and Jake drop the pizza and movies and make a run it, down the street, headed back to the house. The car speeds around the corner, pursuing them. Cassie turns and spots the car barreling towards them.
Get on the sidewalk! Cassie and Jake run onto the sidewalk, off the street and of harm’s way. (CONTINUED )

The car speeds toward them, could easily kill them both, tries not to outrun them. He’s simply toying with them. They quickly approach the house and hurry towards the fro door. They run inside and lock the door.
Cassie and Jake are out of breath, hiding behind the door They peek out the window and spot the pink car sitting outside with the lights on and the engine running.
Come with me! Cassie grabs Jake by the arm as they run into the kitchen phone charger sits empty.
The phone’s gone! Where the hell is it? Cassie and Jake both notice that the back door is wide op Someone has broken in. They look at each other.
What about your cell?
Shit! My Dad took it! Along with my keys! (beat) My Dad! Cassie grabs Jake by the arm and pulls him towards the stairs.
Come on! They hurry up the steps.
Cassie and Jake run into a nearby bedroom. Her fathers. She immediately goes to a corner closet and reaches up as as she can, grabbing a small, leather zipper bag from the shelf. (CONTINUED )
She unzips it and pulls out a chrome-plated snub nose .38 caliber. She checks the chamber for bullets.
Are you gonna shoot him?
No. I’m gonna scare him. Come on. Cassie grabs Jake and pulls him with her.
Cassie and Jake hurry down the steps and approach the fro window. Cassie stares outside at the pink car, lights sti on.
So what’s the plan?
I don’t know! Shut up and let me think! Cassie and Jake stand in silence, neither of them coming with any ideas.
Okay. I know what to do. Just stay here by the door. Be ready to open it. Okay? Jake nods.
Okay. Here I go. Cassie steps out the front door.
Cassie slowly and clumsily begins toward the parked car b the curb, pointing her gun towards it, looking very nervo and unsure of herself.
Alright! The cops are on their way! So you better leave! (CONTINUED )
The car doesn’t budge one inch.
Right now! (beat) If you don’t...I’m gonna shoot! The car simply sits with the engine running. Not moving.
I mean it! I’m gonna count to three! If you're still here...I'm gonna start shooting! Do you hear me?!l... The car still sitting by the curb.
One!...Two!...Three!... The car doesn’t budge.

Alright! That’s it! I’m coming over there! If you’re still here by the time I get over there...1I‘1l blow your head off! Cassie slowly stumbles over to the parked car, her arms f extended, gun pointed at the windshield.

Here I come! (to herself) Oh God, please don’t let me die. Cassie moves closer and closer, walking around the car to driver’s side. She stares into the open window and sees LINDA MOREHOUSE sitting behind the wheel, dead, deep thumb bruises on her neck. Choked to death. Cassie backs up a bit, in shock. An ARM reaches from under the car and grabs her ankle. Cassie trips and falls to the ground, dropping the gun. T gun is tossed a good two feet onto the pavement. The long knife-like fingers of the killer tear at her leg slicing them up. (CONTINUED )

She struggles to stand as the scary man steps from under car. He hovers over her. Cassie finally manages to stand and darts back toward the house. The scary man slowly strides toward her, slow enough to g her a head start. Before Cassie has a chance to beat on the door, Jake open it, letting her in.
Cassie and Jake by the door.
He’s got the gun! Get upstairs! Now! Jake runs up the steps, out of sight. Cassie begins for t garage. She opens a door and runs inside.
Cassie pulls out a large five iron from an old golf bag sitting in a dark corner. She runs back inside.

Cassie heads for the back door to lock it. As she passes through, she looks out the kitchen window and spots THE S MAN passing by. She runs for the back door, trying to beat the killer to She’s too late. THE SCARY MAN enters, holding the .38 snub nose in his ha He slowly begins toward her. He holds out the gun, ready fire. All the color drops from Cassie’s face. She’s a sitting duck. The scary man twirls the gun around on his finger, with t handle now pointing up and out. Pointed at Cassie. Cassie is completely confused by this. She simply stands with the golf club in hand, ready to swing. (CONTINUED )

The scary man walks over to the kitchen counter and sets gun down, with the handle pointed at Cassie, daring her t grab it. He steps a good distance away from it. About as far away from the gun as Cassie is from the gun. Cassie looks back and forth between him and the pistol, contemplating her next move. She makes a run for the star INT. STAIRWAY -— CONTINUOUS Cassie darts up the steps with her golf club, not looking back. On a wall downstairs, we notice the shadow of a man walking towards the staircase, taking his time.
Cassie runs down the hall, searching for a place to hide.
Cassie opens one of the side doors, checking inside the r
Where are you??? Jake opens a door at the end of the hall.
Cassie! Over here! Cassie peeks her head around the door frame, noticing Jak the end of the hall. She runs toward him. She runs inside and shuts the door.

The scary man struts up the steps, taking his time. He steps off and continues down the hall, checking each o the doors. They are all unlocked. In the other hand he is carrying the .38 revolver. He continues checking the doors until he’s reached the en the hall. He grabs the knob and tries to open. It’s locke  48. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake huddle together on the floor, holding eac other tight as they watch the door knob move back and for
(whispers) When he comes in, you hide under the bed.
What're you gonna do?
Shhh! The door knob shaking continues a few seconds. Then...sto altogether.

What’s he doing? EXT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM The scary man steps away from the door and opens the cham on the revolver. INSERT — GUN There are six shots left. He empties the bullets into his palm. All six shots.
He begins tossing them at the door, one by one.
Then another...
Another...
INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake listen at the tapping on the door. (CONTINUED )
What is that? EXT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM The bullets bounce off the door and hit the carpet below.
Then another...
The scary man quietly begins back down the hallway, away the bedroom. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake sitting in complete silence. Waiting.
What’s he waiting on?

I don’t know. EXT. WOODS — NEAR THE PARK Detective Reinhardt and Detective Grimes rustle their way through the dirty wooded area, back at the scene of the crime. They come across the blanket spread out on the ground.
Here’s where the kid found them. Detective Reinhardt looks all around him, staring into th trees.
What're we doing here again?
It’s gotta be around here somewhere.
What has to be around here? (CONTINUED )
He had to have been camped here for the night. It’s the woods. He’s out of sight. It only makes sense.
Don't you think he would've picked up his stuff and covered his tracks by now? The kid saw him. He's a witness.

Exactly. Between me and the kid, I think we scared him off. I don’t think he had time to come back and collect his things. Just keep looking. The two men venture deeper into the woods. Detective Reinhardt hurries faster and faster through the trees. Detective Grimes trying to keep up. EXT. REINHARDT HOME — NIGHT The 1967 Mustang is still parked out front. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Cassie and Jake are still holding each other tight. They' barely budged in hours. Day has now fell to night and the are still waiting in terror.
I think he might be gone.
Maybe. Probably. I haven't heard anything. Jake slowly stares up at Cassie, watching her closely.
Cassie?
Yeah. What is it? (CONTINUED )
Cassie doe 51.
There's something I should probably tell you.
What?

My brother never cheated on you. He just told you that so you'd break up with him. sn‘t quite care at this point. She is scared stiff. Almost frozen with fear. She simply rolls her eyes at the young boy.
Is that so?
He wanted to start seeing this other girl, but wasn’t real sure how to break things off. He figured if he told you he cheated, you'd never wanna talk to him again. I just thought you should know.
(sarcastic) Oh. Okay. I feel a lot better knowing that now, Jake. Thanks.

I know it sounds crazy. But my brother didn’t wanna hurt you. He just didn’t want you to think it was you. It was him. He just wants to see other girls. That’s all. Cassie grows angrier with every word from Jake’s mouth.
He doesn’t even believe in cheating. My Dad cheated once. Almost broke up our family. I guess in a way...he lied for you. To spare you. Cassie squints in confusion. (CONTINUED )

I see. Let me see if I can get this straight. So instead of simply breaking up with me...or being honest and telling me he wanted to see other people...he decided to kick my heart in and embarrass me in front of my friends. All because he wanted to...spare my feelings? Is that what you’re telling me? Jake stares at the wall, pondering it all.
Doesn't make much sense, does it?
Not much. No.

Well. I just thought you should know. Jake stares over at Cassie to see if she’s paying attenti He wants to tell her something. It’s on the tip of his tongue, but can’t seem to spit it out. Something personal

Sometimes I miss my Dad. He's always working. I’m usually in bed by the time he gets home. Cassie isn’t paying much attention. She simply stares at floor, exhausted. When we do talk, all he ever does is yell at me. I get in trouble a lot at school. This catches Cassie’s attention. She can relate.

My guidance counselor thinks it’s because of my father. He says I get myself in trouble for attention. He says I like it when my Dad has to leave work to come talk with the principal. Like I’m getting back at him for not paying enough attention to me. (CONTINUED )
Are you?

I don’t know. I guess in away. I guess I’ve got a lot of anger issues. Kind of like you. Maybe that’s why you said what you did about my brother and Mrs. Clark. Because you want attention. You want people to feel sorry for you.
Oh yeah? Or maybe your brother's just a creep.
So what about you?
What about me?

Studies have proven that when people go through near death experiences together, they form an unlikely bond. They share their inner most secrets with one another. I told you about my brother and my Dad. So what about you? You have anything to tell me? Cassie looks away from Jake, a bit embarrassed. She slowl comes around.

I miss my mother. Sometimes it’s hard not having a woman around to talk to. It’s because of my Dad that I...well...I haven’t been too good with relationships. You know? Boys? It’s like I have this unconscious hatred for men. It’s like deep down I know they’re all gonna grow up to be irresponsible ass holes like my Dad that drink and gamble and screw around on their wives.
He can’t be that bad. (CONTINUED )
My Dad? You don’t know the half of it.
You shouldn’t be so hard on him.
Oh, yeah? Why not?

It's gotta be hard enough on your Dad, being that your Mom’s gone. I think you two should make the best of things and try to get along. Sure would make things a lot nicer around the house. Instead of biting each other’s heads off. But what do I know? I’m just a kid. Cassie turns to Jake, smiles. He’s made a great point and seems to have touched a nerve with Cassie.
I wasn’t completely honest with you about my mother.
What do you mean?
I mean she’s dead. Jake is shocked by Cassie’s secret. He simply stares at t floor. Cassie huf
About four months after she split, she was diagnosed with leukemia. A little under a year later, she died. It’s like she just couldn't take it anymore and her body just gave out. fs in pure disgust.
Can you believe that? My own mother was dying and I couldn’t even be there for her. (CONTINUED )
Cassie shakes her head in bitter disgust. Bad memories of her mother’s illness are hitting her like a sack of brick

She was always healthy as a horse. Worked out, ran three miles a day. She’d never even been to the doctor. Not once. They told me cancer killed my mother, but I know better. That bastard made her sick. All she did was worry about me. She worried so much, it killed her.

My grandmother had cancer. She died. Her and my grandfather were married forty five years. They loved each other. Whatever you think your Dad did to your Mom, you shouldn't think that. I’m sure he misses her as much as you.

When that gun was pointed at me. I thought that was it. That I was never gonna see my Dad again. I remembered what it was like to lose my mother. I got so scared. I guess I have been too hard on him lately.
You guys should have a talk.
Yeah. You‘re right. Maybe you and your Dad should talk too.
Only if you do. Cassie smiles.
I promise. Jake turns his attention to the door. He watches it carefully.
Why do you think he didn’t kill us? (CONTINUED )
How am I supposed to know?
We should check to see if his car is still here.
It is. I just checked a minute ago. We would have heard it.
Maybe he ran away. All of the sudden there is the sound of FOOTSTEPS coming the hall. The floor creaks a bit.
Oh my God.
He‘s coming.

head_text.subj: THE FOOTSTEPS STOP AT THE DOOR

text: Cassie spots a YELLOW NOTE being slid under the door. Something written on notebook paper. She carefully walks over and picks it up. It says...
Cassie shows it to Jake.
I’m gonna check it out.
Are you crazy? Don’t open the door.

Just stay back. Jake hands her the golf club. Cassie slowly opens the door and stares down the hall. CASSIE’S P.O.V. She spots the .38 snub nose laying on the floor in front the bathroom. The gun is all the way at the end of the ha (CONTINUED )
Cassie stares down at the floor and spots the six bullets scattered all over the place.
Cassie steps into the hall.
Cassie quickly bends down and begins picking up the shell one by one. She stuffs them in her pocket and shuts the door. INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM
Stay here. Whatever happens, stay put and keep the door locked.
Where are you going?
To check something.
Forget that. You’re not leaving me here. I’m going with you.
No you're not.
Yes I am! I’m not staying in here! Cassie is red with anger. She quickly kneels in front of Jake, grabbing him by both arms and jerking him toward he Her eyes wide and focused.

Look. My Dad gave me real simple instructions. And that’s to keep an eye on you until he gets back. If you get killed, I'm never gonna see my cell phone or my car keys again. We don’t have a car...a phone...or a weapon. I think our situation is bad enough without you complicating it. (MORE) (CONTINUED )
CASSIE (cont'd) So just sit down and be quiet until I can figure things out. Got it? Jake senses the seriousness in Cassie’s eyes. He backs of
I got it.
Good. Now lock the door behind me. Cassie leaves. Jake quickly locks the door behind her.

Cassie holds up the five iron, ready to strike as she slo shuffles down the hallway. CASSIE’S P.O.V. She watches each door carefully as she makes her way clos to the gun. She comes into view of the staircase. She looks down the steps and spots the scary man, a.k.a. ALEX ROOKER standin near the top. Now branding a steak knife from the kitchen

Cassie stares back and forth between him and the gun on t ground. A few moments pass and she forcefully tosses the golf club at his head. He ducks, barely dodging it. Cassie charges after the gun, grabbing it from the floor, is eventually grabbed from behind by Alex. He pushes her against a wall, pulling her arm behind her back, listening to her SCREAM out in pain. He pushes her face into the wall so hard she can barely catch a breath. He slides the tip of the knife up and down her back as sh struggles to breath. He pulls her away from the wall and pushes her into the bathroom. Cassie stumbles to the cold, hard floor. She quickly shut the door on him. INT. BATHROOM — CONTINUOUS Cassie locks the door on Alex. She looks over at the mirr and notices in bright red letters... (CONTINUED )
Cassie frantically begins searching for weapons. She rummages through the cabinets under the sink and spots a first aide kit.

-- She grabs a small pair of sucres and stuffs them in he pants. -- Spots a candle sitting on the counter. -- Searching the drawers. Finds an ignitor, the kind used for lighting barbecues. -- She stuffs the lighter in her belt loop as if she was cowboy carrying a gun. -- Spots a can of AIR FRESHENER sitting on the sink. She stuffs that in her pants along with the small scissors. -- Takes off one of her socks. Drops a bar of soap into i Slaps the homemade weapon into her palm, trying it out. EXT. REINHARDT HOME —- NIGHT A CAR slowly pulls to the curb, just a couple houses down from the Reinhardt’s. Out steps

The slovenly loan shark from the park. He is branding a small caliber weapon in his belt. He quietly begins towar the Reinhardt house, suspiciously watching his surroundin Checking for witnesses and such. Archie begins around the house, to the back yard.

Archie approaches the back door, staring inside. He quiet opens the door and enters. He pulls the weapon from his b and slowly moves through the house, searching for any sig of life. He spots Dave’s office in the corner and begins toward it  60. INT. DAVE’S OFFICE Archie enters. He begins toward Dave’s desk, searching al the drawers. One of the drawers is locked. He uses a knif to jimmy the drawer open. Inside is a small, manila envel filled with loose bills. He gives the cash another good sniff.

Mmmm. Second best smell in the world. Archie looks up, notices the shadow of a man walking past office. He drops the envelope and points his gun in the direction of the doorway. He slowly begins out of the office.
Archie walks out. He turns to the right and begins toward corner bedroom. The door is wide open.
He steps inside and notices...

head_text.subj: A BODY OF A PERSON UNDER THE SHEETS

text: He slowly begins toward the bed with his gun pointed at t body.

Nap time’s over, David. He pulls the sheet back. It’s a bunch of pillows. ALEX appears behind Archie. His face curtailed by his lon hair. Archie senses someone behind him and spins around, pointi his gun at Alex.
Who the hell are you? Alex simply stands...silent.
Okay. You don’t wanna talk to me? (CONTINUED )
Archie pulls the hammer back on his gun.
Talk to this. In a blink of an eye, Alex TWISTS ARCHIE’S WRIST AROUND s that the gun is pointed at Archie. Before the gun goes off...
INT. CASSIE’S BEDROOM Jake is still waiting patiently. Very still. Then...
The sound of Archie's weapon going off causes him to jump
Cassie?
Cassie is visibly startled by the gunshot.

Dad.

There was this kid who the police department liked for it. An ex boyfriend of the victim. A rich kid named Danny Myers. The media hated this kid. He was really arrogant and cocky. He even bragged about how he wished he was the one who killed her. The TV and newspapers made him out to be the killer before all the evidence was in.
I remember. It was all over TV. Your dad was the head detective back then, wasn’t he? Cassie nods.

They were putting a lot of pressure on my Dad to put him away. When he couldn’t get any evidence against Myers to stick, they did an investigation. They found out he took money from this kid’s parents. Twenty thousand dollars.
They paid your Dad off?

My Dad had all these outstanding football debts. He bet a lot back then. Until these men came to the house one night and told him if he didn’t come up with twenty grand by the end of the week, my mother and I would disappear. So he told the Myers, for the right price, he’d bury any evidence connecting their son to the murder. He was desperate. He didn’t have a choice. (CONTINUED )
But what about Myers? Did he do it?

My Dad never liked Myers for the killer. He always thought the real guy was more of a loner. Not popular like this other kid. Someone who wasn’t good with girls. Someone who had either killed before or was gonna kill again. Myers had a clean record. He didn’t fit the profile.
So what happened to him?
To Myers? Nothing. This same killer murdered five other girls since my Dad was thrown off the force. Danny Myers had a solid alibi for all of them. It couldn’t have been him.
So the guy I saw in the woods today was the real killer?
He must‘ve seen you with my Dad and decided to follow you home.

I don't know. Maybe we’re like his hostages or something. Maybe he’s planning on using us as bait for my father. One thing’s for sure. We just can’t sit here and wait for him to kill us.
So what are we gonna do?
If I can make it to the computer, I can myspace some people for help. (MORE) (CONTINUED )
